Semantic ranking is now language-agnostic.Language analyzer considerationsIndexes that contain non-English content often use language analyzers on non-Englishfields to apply the linguistic rules of the native language.
When adding spell check to content that also undergoes language analysis, you canachieve better results using the same language for each indexing and query processingstep. For example, if a field's content was indexed using the "fr.microsoft" languageanalyzer, then queries and spell check should all use a French lexicon or language libraryof some form. To recap how language libraries are used in Azure AI Search:Language analyzers can be invoked during indexing and query execution, and areeither Apache Lucene (for example, "de.lucene") or Microsoft ("de.microsoft).Language lexicons invoked during spell check are specified using one of thelanguage codes in the supported language table.
